Reviews.Title: great but 128GB? really?
Reviews.Author: Ali A. Nawfal "Al."
Reviews.Content: -amazing laptop, only problem is who in the hell creates a computer with 128GB of storage!!I understand its a solid state but come on!-if ur planning on buying this computer because its the cheapest retina display, i suggest u buy an external hard drive.

Reviews.Title: Wonderful computer
Reviews.Author: Abdullah
Reviews.Content: Nice product from AppleI like it  It is wonderful computer withRetina display that is amazingAlso , I like the Mac os

Reviews.Title: pretty fast
Reviews.Author: Shaofeng Chen
Reviews.Content: overall the mac is pretty fast, can run a lot of applications parallel and still has excellent reaction. Love it

Reviews.Title: Amazon base price is wrong
Reviews.Author: John
Reviews.Content: The correct base price for this model is $1499, not $1699 as stated at the top of the page, so you're really only saving about $100 by buying it from Amazon.  Not $300.

Reviews.Title: Great computer
Reviews.Author: A. Decker "Boating enthusiast"
Reviews.Content: I love my new Mac Book Pro  great retina display  Very fast speed  and good sound when listening to  music  One of my best decisions I've made  I recommend highly

Reviews.Title: Macbook pro retina 13 inch display
Reviews.Author: Neanderthal
Reviews.Content: Nice upgrade from my 5 year old black macbook. Much faster login and uploading than the older unit. Love the Retina display for sharper viewing of my photos. I use this laptop a lot for digital photography and like the fact that it has an SD card reader built in, also I like the backlit keyboard which I did not have before. Also like the fact that it has a solid state hard drive. Not so sure about apple ditching the CD drive but so far I haven't missed it too much. I am very happy with my purchase so far.

Reviews.Title: Great
Reviews.Author: ALLAN R. OLIVEIRA
Reviews.Content: It is great, works for everything that stands for. I recommend anyone to buy it. It was a great purchase.

Reviews.Title: Money well spent
Reviews.Author: Ben Lewis
Reviews.Content: I love this thing.  it is super fast and is perfect for travel.  The screen is amazing and easy to look at for long periods of time.

Reviews.Title: John F
Reviews.Author: John F
Reviews.Content: As a writer I was looking for a laptop that was light weight, durible, and had a processor that can handle multiple applications running at the same time. This laptop was just that. With a retnia display that makes viewing movies or pictures a most enjoyable experience. It also has a modern sleek look that draws compliments whenever I go.

Reviews.Title: Thrilled
Reviews.Author: Anne Cohen "Dramatic Soprano"
Reviews.Content: I have had a Macbook 1181A since 2009. Worked fine, still works ok but slower and I wanted something faster with a better screen resolution. This fit the bill perfectly. Love it! If you're undecided between this and the previous version without the Retina screen, I highly recommend this version. It's worth the extra few hundred bucks to me.

Reviews.Title: Best choice ever
Reviews.Author: Alexander
Reviews.Content: The MacBook is fantastic I haven't try it yet my friend will give it to me in 4 days , she told me it arrived on time and before then we expected thanks data vision and amazon we will be in contactAlexander baillie

Reviews.Title: Awesome!!
Reviews.Author: Andres van der Horst
Reviews.Content: This macbook fits all my needs. Its not heavy and its super fast. Also the SSD makes it a better computer.

Reviews.Title: Awesome notebook!
Reviews.Author: Dylan
Reviews.Content: The MacBook Pro w/ Retina Display is simply a great laptop! No freezing, no crashing, and certainly MUCH better than Windows! A great investment for anyone who is looking to upgrade their computer experience!

Reviews.Title: product design and operation is great
Reviews.Author: Michael Serleth
Reviews.Content: what else could be said that has not already been said?  I do wish it had an Ethernet port on the computer

Reviews.Title: I am a Mac convert
Reviews.Author: GG "GG"
Reviews.Content: I am really enjoying this laptop - glad i got it and I got a discount during the Amazon Thanksgiving sale. The only thng is some programs aren't compatible with Mac versus Windows.

Reviews.Title: I love it...
Reviews.Author: Kevin Pastaurin "qumi q2"
Reviews.Content: I love the computer i couldn't asked for a better computer. Anybody looking to get a computer should look to get a Macbook Pro with Retina Display..

Reviews.Title: It didn't accomplish my expectations (moving from Windows and Open Source OSs)
Reviews.Author: Sergio
Reviews.Content: I've been using Windows a lot, and a different Open Source OS's for work.  And finally I decided to buy this machine for work and RAW photography processing, since Mac has a great user-friendly and stability reputation. I don't want to worry about computer problems a lot anymore.My expectations were:I - User friendly laptop so I don't worry fixing computer issues instead to be productive. That's why I choose a Mac product.II - Relative fast computer for scientific data processing, image analysis and RAW photography processing. Also for watching movies sometimes. That's why I choose a retina Macbook ProIII - Great portability for travel. This is: relatively small, thin, light and high battery duration. That's why I choose a 13-inch instead 15-inch.So what I found in this computer was:(+):1. Screen, of course... this is a spectacular screen: great for image processing, so that is one point to favor.2. Fast CPU: I use Matlab and Wolfram Mathematica a lot for data processing and image analysis and this computer does the job quite good and fast.3. portability: very thin for the power and also it feels very light. Excellent battery duration (when I was in the train I turned WIFI OFF and I had 10 hour battery duration. With wifi ON could be 7 hours... now I have 12% of max capacity and it says 50min remaining)(-):main disappointments:1. (Hardware Performance) Wifi - Bluethooth problems at first day of use: slow wifi when bluethooth is ON2. (Instabilities and errors) Alias (Mac shortcuts) serious problems caused 50% Mac storage use: I cannot delete the alias after I copy 60Gb of videos and photography to a backup, I'm been reading a lot of forums threads and my problems hasn't been solved yet...3. (Instabilities and errors) It cannot play 60p videos at 60fps, despite it says is a 60hz display: I'm using a Sony HDR-CX260V High Definition Handycam 8.9 MP Camcorder with 30x Optical Zoom and 16 GB Embedded Memory (Black) (2012 Model) and is a pity that I cannot watch my Full HD "high speed" videos (60p) at their original speed in the rMBP.4. edit: (Instabilities and errors) Professional software crashes: I'm using ImageJ and Mathematica (lastest versions for Mac) and I'm experimenting a lot of crashes (OS is fully upgraded). I've been using these softwares and same codes in Windows and I didn't have those crashes... those problems make me lose a lot of time in data analysis...another disappointments:3. (Design) Keyboard may be printed in the screen4. (Hardware Performance) solid state drive is not fast as I expected to be (reboot, copy files, running programs)5. (Hardware Performance) The video card is awful for playing in retina full size, although I knew that and I accepted it... it still been a disappointment. How can this amazing screen has this video card? (I know that I said it was for work but is a temptation to play, for example, Diablo III or Starcraft II or Civilization V)6. Comparing with the Lenovo Z580 (see EDIT)the website loads are a lot slower (using the same WIFI always), also the overall loads and photography processing is slower in the rMBP, since again there are too much pixels to manage...Conclusions: I bought this laptop less than one month ago and I have been dealing with very annoying issues. I'm in a short-term internship in the US so I want to be productive instead dedicating my time to be fixing new Mac laptop issues, for example I have to move about 40Gb of data from an external HDD to the rMBP but I have corrupted files which are using about 60Gb of the 120Gb and I cannot delete them (even with secure delete or terminal or Disk utilities...) . I'm seriously thinking to return this product (I have 2 more weeks for that) and to buy maybe an Asus Zenbook or something similar. I'm quite disappointed.EDIT (talking about the RETURN and what laptop I chose after the rMBP):  I finally returned this laptop for a full refund (thanks amazon), since I had to much annoying wifi, SSD and OSX issues; also the lack of decent performance for an overpriced (US$1614.00) laptop, I believed in apple reputation for the price, but it vanished quickly. Instead of that I bought a Lenovo z580 (Win8, i5 3210M, 8Gb Ram, Intel HD4000 Graphics, 15.6',750Gb Hdd) for $540.00 and it runs great, it doesn't print the keyboard in the screen, the overall performance is much better for me, no crushes, no issues, no inestabilities, a lot faster photography processing, and the WIFI feels faster as well, I almost hear the fan and everything is cool even with high loads of data... Also it has VGA port (that I use a lot for meetings and presentations, 4 USB ports (2x3.0,2x2.0)... I always use 2 (1 for mouse and 1 for external USB 3.0 HDD) and is nice to have some more to connect the camera or colleagues flash drives. Is nice to have ethernet port as well... the max battery life is around 6-7 hours so that's great for the price.  Should I add $1100 for a 120gb SSD (~$100), smaller but retina display? backlit keyboard? lighter? better multitouch trackpad? but less wifi performance, less usb ports, no VGA, no ethernet... Nah... $1100 is too much difference for the same internal performance laptop and some sacrifices! If you want it for more portability, to edit or just watch photography one by one, to brag with friends or just have a astonishing screen for studing, and obviously, if you can afford it... I think this is for you, and now the price is lower. I feel much better now and I saved ~$1100

Reviews.Title: I have issues with this product
Reviews.Author: blah
Reviews.Content: I got this laptop in september for work and like it, the construction overall is sturdy and the keyboard feels great to type on. The main problem I have is that pixels keep going bad. It is not a huge deal because they only show up when viewing black/dark images but for the price it is a concern. So far four have gone bad and if any more go I will be seeking a fix/replacement from apple. Also worth noting that you are paying for slimness here not performance. I have three computers: cutting edge windows 8.1 GTX 780 and I5-357, Older linux desktop and this one which actually cost the most out of the three. You pay a premium for apple products and after buying this I would say the price is not worth it.

Reviews.Title: Too hyped
Reviews.Author: richard r hays
Reviews.Content: It's an Apple so I like the operating system better than PC but I expected God to show up on the screen the way they were talking about Retina display.  I can't tell that much difference between it and my I Mac I bought 5 years ago.  So little difference I called Apple to make sure my serial # was correct for Retina display.  Total hype as far as I'm concerned.

Reviews.Title: Apple MacBook Pro w/Retina Display
Reviews.Author: Carin Haeger
Reviews.Content: Luv, Luv, Luv my Apple Macbook Pro!!!  Switched from Microsoft to Apple as I am an iPhone user!!  Excellent Service thru Apple with any questions and automatically int

Reviews.Title: It's an Apple...  what's there more to say?
Reviews.Author: Cockers in Larsworld
Reviews.Content: I bought this laptop for my husband... his christmas gift.  He loves it!!  Especially the Retina Display. Now all he has to do is learn how to use his applications and then he'll be an expert.

Reviews.Title: Amazing
Reviews.Author: Kat
Reviews.Content: I have always loved Apple products, but sometimes I get turned off by the prices. So, I decided to cheat and as I was looking for a less expensive Apple Macbook Pro with Retina display and I came across this one. I bought this mainly to use for the rest of high school and for college, and I must say, I don't think I've ever loved anything quite as much as this baby right here. The only downside was that I had to update a few things. (Which only consumed about 10 minutes of my time so it's okay.)  So, all in all this is a fantastic computer! :)

Reviews.Title: Love my new MacBook Pro!
Reviews.Author: Diane D "mystic"
Reviews.Content: I have used PCs for years and the new MacBook Pro with Retina Display is awesome.It is so easy to use and has a low learning curve.  The display is amazing, clear and crisp.I used a Mac at work many years ago but this was more amazing to work with.And it works on the ICloud so I can share my photos and music on my Iphone.  Love it!

Reviews.Title: love it
Reviews.Author: akhil meda
Reviews.Content: its perfect. Just what i wanted it to be.loving my experience and is my first apple product. worth buying

Reviews.Title: Purchased for my wife, wanted desperately to keep it!
Reviews.Author: Miech
Reviews.Content: I have been with apple for many years. One of my favorite models was my old Titanium G4 that got me through a good seven years or so of computing. I have seen Macbooks evolve over the past few years and I am pleased with Apple's new offerings. The new Retina display may seem gimmicky, but once you get a hold of one, and have Retina-compatible updates installed to your software base, it is clear that this is not a gimmick and destined to be the future of modern computing.Display aside, the combination of the i5 processor and the larger batter give this model a fantastic battery life. Out of the box, my late 2008 MBP (Core2) got maybe 1.5 hours. This new model can go hours between charges. The Late 2008 model is always running hot (upwards of 95-105 celcius when doing actual work) whereas this model barely breaks a sweat at 40C.The few design decisions I don't like (and would have resulted in a 4.5 rating if possible) are as follows:1) 2 Thunderbolt ports. Frankly, I don't see myself ever owning a thunderbolt product and the support out there is terrible.2) 2 USB ports. I would have liked to see one more USB.3) No Wired Ethernet.4) Unnecessary change in Mag-Safe tip (Again).

Reviews.Title: Loved it
Reviews.Author: Cindylou
Reviews.Content: I'm just now getting around to reviewing this...this was my first macbook purchase and I've converted.  Best laptop I've owned.

Reviews.Title: So far so good
Reviews.Author: Keith
Reviews.Content: Greg did an excellent job working with me to get the geek squad protection transferred in my name. The Mac is in great condition, and performs very well

Reviews.Title: apple forever and ever!!!
Reviews.Author: pablo
Reviews.Content: I like this laptop....apple make things really incredible..it is an excellent factory...my mac is esplendit...for its design...I try to compare with others laptops but definite I can't compare....cuz apple is other technology....

Reviews.Title: MacBook Pro
Reviews.Author: Paulette Shepherd
Reviews.Content: Enjoy how fast the system boots up, had trouble updating the Operating system, the Apple store helped with no charge. Especially love weight and screen size.

Reviews.Title: MacBook Pro Retina 13" - Fantastic display
Reviews.Author: Thiago Fernandes de Moura
Reviews.Content: the display and performance are just fantastic, life battery also is great if you really need mobility, but out of power source it start to get very hot.

Reviews.Title: Its an awesome laptop. No doubt.
Reviews.Author: Nanda Kishore
Reviews.Content: Awesome for reading text(except to spend million hours on Quora reading Q/A) and coding. Space is a bit of limitation as it comes preloaded with 128 SSD alone. But manageable.  Ultra light and awesome battery backup.

Reviews.Title: No complaint
Reviews.Author: michael Tsang
Reviews.Content: I really like this laptop with Retina display. i am not very happy to have a DVD to link with.

Reviews.Title: Beautiful display
Reviews.Author: James A. Clarke
Reviews.Content: If you're thinking of the macbook air, or thinking of the 15", this is the best middle ground. Enough power to get anything and everything done... But has the BEAUTIFUL retina display that once you see, you have to get...Computers now are like buying a new tv, would you buy one thats not HD? Then why consider one that isnt a retina?Think about it... and then shovel out the extra cash. You wont regret it.Ps- no DVD drive?? who would buy an air!

Reviews.Title: muito bom
Reviews.Author: Jorge Silveira
Reviews.Content: muito bom gostei muito, demorou um dia a mais para chegar mas deu o tempo certo, chegou no endereço certo sem problema

Reviews.Title: REVIEWS are for PURCHASES
Reviews.Author: Poltergiest
Reviews.Content: I AGREE and state also"These are REVIEWS! Meaning after you have purchased the item, you review it based on experience with the item, NOT ASSUMPTIONS AND PREMONITIONS! Almost ALL BAD reviews about the MBP-r are written by people who do not own this product, and more than likely someone who cannot afford it."

Reviews.Title: 7 out of 10
Reviews.Author: Valerie B.
Reviews.Content: Lovely computer. Lighter, faster and clearer, but the camera! The fist generation macbook has a better camera. I didnt pay $1500 for this.

Reviews.Title: WARNING - READ THIS BEFORE YOU BUY APPLE
Reviews.Author: Frank Erfurth
Reviews.Content: If you are purchasing an Apple computer for ease of use and a super user-friendly GUI, go ahead and push "BUY IT NOW".  But if you are migrating over to Apple to take advantage of the apparent bargains to be found in the professional software arena (Music Production, Video Production, Graphic Arts, etc.) I am issuing a warning that Apple is lying to you.  Apple has implemented an aberrant pricing policy that varies widely from the industry standard pricing policy for professional software.  Apple, in true corporate fashion, has made this change without warning or notice.  The new policy is NO PATH TO UPGRADE.  You heard me right.  If you pay professional software prices for a piece of Apple software, and two months later they release the new and improved package, you will be stuck paying full price for the upgrade.  Do you feel like you got a deal now?  You have now paid more for your software than if you had gone with the industry leading software package (PreSONUS, Adobe Premiere, CorelDraw, etc.) and next update, you will be well behind the pricing curve.  I do not have a problem with Apple software, but rather the sneaky way in which they implemented the pricing policy.  If you are buying Apple to take advantage of these apparent deals...save your money and stick with a PC.  You will pay more initially for your software, but within a year you will be saving money.

Reviews.Title: Does not come pre-installed with OSX Mountain Lion as advertised
Reviews.Author: A. Ratna
Reviews.Content: Ordered this device last week. The machine came pre-installed with OSX 10.8.1 and not OSX Mountain Lion which is V10.8.2 as advertised. A day and a half and 4 support sessions later, I have tried everything from installing and installing two different versions of the Mac OSX Installer and trying a system reboot with OS upgrade. On the fourth call i was informed that this failure is a known issue and Apple is working on resolving it.Otherwise the machine is a beauty. The system is almost instantly on on opening the lid. A a new PC to Mac user, I love the flow and the interface. The 13.3 inch form factor feels much more compact and portable than the 15 inch machine and the display real estate seems surprisingly satisfying.Microsoft Office applications seem grainier than their Apple counterparts though.Overall, a great investment for browsing, photos, movies and reading. The retina display lives up to the billing. Yet to fuly dive into using Microsoft Office to verify its utility for work.

Reviews.Title: it froze on me, I just Got it less than a month ago!!!
Reviews.Author: Joseph Mendoza
Reviews.Content: I was working with a couple of apps open then suddenly the cursor went into a slow motion then a color pinwill appeared then it froze I cant turn it off! the cursor wont move.! I was fraustrated, you know, being a new Mac user. It went like that for 30 mins then when I push the power button again it turned off. Then I restart it. It is now working normally, but I called Apple support they said there is a big chance that it wont happened again. The customer service from apple was nice and all but the product being this new should not go freezing like that.. I'm just saying.

Reviews.Title: Apple Mac
Reviews.Author: bet
Reviews.Content: Hated this thing. Sent it back. Screen was too small. Wayyyyyy overpriced. The Retina Display no big deal to pay this much for.

ProductInfo.Features:
2.5 GHz dual-core Intel Core i5 processor (Turbo Boost up to 3.1GHz) with 3MB shared L3 cache
8 GB of 1600MHz DDR3L onboard memory
128 GB Flash Storage
13.3 inch LED-backlit Retina display, 2560-by-1600 native resolution, Intel HD Graphics 4000
Mac OS X Mountain Lion, 7 Hour Battery Life. Item comes with 10.8 version of the OS
ProductInfo.Name: Apple MacBook Pro MD212LL/A 13-Inch Laptop with Retina Display (OLD VERSION)
